metadata.title: Guide to Analyzing and Reporting Groups in Pol.is Conversations
metadata.purpose: Generate consistent, evidence-based reports comparing groups and describing the key differences between them

criticalInstructions.instruction: Generate a JSON response that conforms to the provided schema. DO NOT INCLUDE ANY OTHER TEXT.
DO NOT return ```json at the beginning of the response. This is not markdown. Do not end the response with ```, your response MUST begin with { and end with }

term.name: group_differences
term.description: Notable difference in views between groups, especially comments where groups disagreed significantly

term.name: extreme_differences
term.description: Very large difference in views between groups (typically where one group strongly agrees and another strongly disagrees)

criticalInstructions.instruction: Focus on the full set of groups, not just pairs of groups. Describe the constellation of views across all groups.
Use specific statements to illustrate group positions, but do so in service of showing broader patterns rather than isolated points.
Avoid generic descriptions. Instead, characterize each group by their distinctive positions and apparent priorities or values.

paragraph.format:
Analysis of voting patterns revealed [number_of_groups] distinct groups with different perspectives on key issues. These groups were primarily defined by their positions on [key_division_theme], particularly regarding [specific_aspect]. [Additional_high_level_context].
The most significant divisions between groups emerged around [major_division_topic], with [description_of_key_disagreement]. This reflected deeper differences in [values/priorities/concerns], especially in discussions of [related_subtopic]. [Additional_insight_if_relevant].
[If extreme polarization exists] Particularly stark contrasts appeared in positions on [polarizing_topic], where Groups [X] and [Y] took [diametrically_opposed_positions] on [specific_statements]. This division highlighted fundamental differences in [underlying_values_or_frameworks].

paragraphInstructions.instruction: Provide a comprehensive overview that: - Introduces all identified groups - Highlights major lines of division - Connects specific differences to broader themes - Avoids overemphasizing any single statement or division - Provides multiple specific examples with appropriate citations

criticalInstructions.instruction: For each key division, explain both WHAT groups disagree about AND WHY they likely disagree (different values, priorities, assumptions, etc.). Avoid simplistic explanations.
Draw connections between different points of disagreement to reveal patterns in group thinking, not just isolated differences.
Be precise in characterizing each group's position. Avoid reducing complex stances to simple agree/disagree dichotomies when more nuanced patterns exist.

paragraph.format:
Group [A], comprising approximately [percentage_estimate]% of participants, demonstrated strong [agreement/disagreement] with statements addressing [topic_X]. Their voting pattern revealed consistent emphasis on [value_or_priority], particularly regarding [specific_aspect]. This was most evident in their [strong/moderate] [agreement/disagreement] with statements about [specific_subtopic].
In contrast, Group [B] prioritized [different_value_or_priority], consistently supporting positions that [description_of_position]. This group's perspective was characterized by [distinctive_feature_of_voting_pattern], especially on statements related to [topic_Y]. Their approach to [shared_topic] differed fundamentally from Group [A] in terms of [specific_dimension_of_difference].
Group [C]'s voting pattern suggested a more [nuanced/moderate/distinctive] position, frequently [agreeing/disagreeing] with statements about [topic_Z] while taking a more [qualified/strong/unique] stance on [related_topic]. Their responses indicated particular concern with [specific_issue], setting them apart from both Groups [A] and [B].
[If more than three groups] The remaining groups showed varying degrees of alignment on different issues. Group [D] closely resembled Group [A] on matters of [shared_topic] but diverged regarding [point_of_difference]. Meanwhile, Group [E] stood out for their distinctive perspective on [unique_topic], taking positions that didn't clearly align with any other group.

paragraphInstructions.instruction: For each group, provide: - Clear characterization of their distinctive positions - Multiple supporting examples with appropriate citations - Analysis of underlying values or priorities - Comparison with other groups' positions - Connections between different position statements to reveal coherent group perspective

case.description: Group that shares positions with different groups on different issues
Group that is internally divided on specific issues

validationRules.rule: All group characterizations must be based on multiple statements from data
Each claim requires at least one citation
Groups must be referenced by actual group identifiers from data
